website_summaries.verdict: A rock-solid choice for shorter hikes, this option also comes with roomy storage options.
pros: Very easy to set up and break down
Good-size vestibule to store your gear
Sturdy in high winds, and very dry in rain
cons: Floor is a bit thin, although you can spend a little more to get a footprint to go with it

website_summaries.verdict: A versatile tent that can be used in a variety of ways to enhance your backpacking expedition.
pros: Includes a built-in ground cloth to spare your need to carry an extra tarp
Ground cloth also keeps the heat in during cold weather
You can set up the rain fly to serve as a dining fly, which is a great place to store gear and even cook under to shield rain
Has 3 mesh sides for great ventilation in hot weather
We like the crossbar supports for extra strength
cons: This tent is not great for tall people
Has some performance problems with the sealing on the end of the rain flap

customer_reviews.title: I love and adore it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tent for about 2 years now. I love and adore it, and it's lasted a bunch of trips. It is a great fit for one person plus gear (I'm a strong independent hiking woman who don't need no man). I also love that the rain cover goes all the way to the ground and has a vestibule to keep the dirty stuff outside and dry.
customer_reviews.author: kattanfan07

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME TENT!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Listen here my fellow campers. I am one of those people that does extensive research before making any purchase so that I am sure its what I want, and I dont end up spending 100+ dollars on something I will regret later. I was so happy with this purchase, I am not sure where to start explaining. Ive camped probably 8 times with this tent since Ive bought it, from Desert heat in the Mojave to Snow in the Sequoias, even really windy conditions at the top of some ridges, even rain and hail storms. This tent has not only held up great, but its kept me really dry.
customer_reviews.author: J. Quinones

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight backpacking tent for one person
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent to backpack in on a bow hunting trip this past fall with some buddies that had bivy sacks. I definitely had the best setup especially after a rain storm hit on the second day. Everything stayed dry. Hard to beat this tent ounce for ounce against the other companies selling lightweight tents. The tent is definitely a single person tent. Just enough room to sleep in and just enough room in the vestibule to store a pack and all your food.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Calvert

customer_reviews.title: found a footprint tarp that works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Just wanted to add that this specific tarp ( has grommet holes spaced exactly 32" apart, which lines up almost perfectly with the tent's pole corners. So you could buy this cheap tarp instead of the tent's footprint (sold separately) if you wanted to have a free standing rainfly without tent. The blue tarp also covers the vestibule area, while the tent's footprint (sold separately) only covers the tent's floor area. The tarp is supposedly 6'x8' but is actually 5'6"x7'6" which again lines up almost perfectly with the tent's dimensions, so it's an almost perfect match.
customer_reviews.author: BonumSufficit

customer_reviews.title: ((INITIAL REVIEW)) This looks like it could be a winner
customer_reviews.text: ((INITIAL REVIEW)) This looks like it could be a winner. I really like that it came with a patches in different colors for repairs and the guidelines has easy line tensioners. I purchased the floor saver with this tent and posted a review on that. With the floor saver and this tent you can easily setup the rainfly before you setup your tent. By doing this you prevent water from getting into your tent while you set it up. I'll update this review after I put it to the test in the field. I have attached photos for those who prefer to view then read.
customer_reviews.author: ChrisR

customer_reviews.title: I should have listened to the other reviews...
customer_reviews.text: I should have listened to the other reviews, I knew it would be small, but it was very small, since I have no comparison I can't really fault that, but be aware it is a 1 person tent for a very small person. But the biggest issue, the first night out in the rain the rain fly leaked like crazy. So there I was out on a motorcycle camping trip and I got soaked during the night and most of my gear got soaked too. Do not believe that the fly will keep you dry because it won't. I returned immediately upon my return and bought a proper tent for my next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Vonjentzen

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I ultralight section hike on the AT, and this tent is a bit heavier than i would like. That said this is still my go to tent when i think it might be heavy rain and wind during my outting. You can't beat the price and simplicity of this tent. Really well made and I would buy it again if something happened to mine. The floor is pretty durable and keeps rain/water out.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry DTop Contributor: Magic: The Gathering

customer_reviews.title: A bit smaller than expected, but comfy and has good wind insulation
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a tent by ALPS Mountaineering and have been extremely satisfied with their company. This tent is, so far, no exception. It is a bit smaller than my old one but is comfortable, has a nice vestibule size and provides good wind insulation on cooler evenings. I thoroughly look forward to take it on my trip from Mount Katahdin to Springer Mountain and will update accordingly. So far, damn well worth the money. Update: Used it for two weeks and a tent poles broke. Contacted the returns department and am waiting to hear back. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: j e creek

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Ok. It’s not a bad tent. That said it came with a 2” hole in the mesh seam. I tried to return it to the manufacturer and they wanted me to cut the logo off and a tag and send it in to them, then they would send me a new shell in the mail. But, make sure to keep all the poles and everything... I said that seemed like a lot for me to have to do and they, more or less, said tough.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I got this tent for a 5 day backpacking trip, while it served its purpose for having a place to sleep and being small and light weight I was let down. Days before the trip I was contemplating spraying it with a waterproofer/repellant but opted not to since the seams and floor were already supposed to be sealed. I was kicking myself because 4 out of the 5 days it rained and I was sleeping in quite a few puddles and any gear that could've stayed dry didn't. It's a decent tent but definitely spray it.
customer_reviews.author: Andy S.

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with its performance
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from an overnight trip with the new Lynx 1. Very satisfied with its performance. Super easy to set up and take down and just plain works. I removed the poles and stakes and stuffed the tent and fly into the included stuff sack. This fit perfectly into the bottom of my pack and the poles and stakes fit perfectly in my side pocket. Hiked 11 miles and had camp setup up in 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Have owned several "1-man" tents before but the x-frame on this makes it free-standing. Simple and quick to set up. Reasonably high quality and lightweight. You'll need to stake out the fly front and back if you're expecting rain. Crafted a Tyvek groundcloth (cut to size and installed grommets) which covers the vestibule floor (as the ALPS ground cloth does not). Overall an excellent 1-man tent for the price. Just finished a week (with occasional overnight rain) on the southern end of the AT. Stayed dry. Reasonably lightweight if you discard the stakes/guyline/carry bags you don't intend to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up/break down.
customer_reviews.text: My first tiny tent. Works great, room for me in there with some small gear items at the foot or head...really easy to set up and break down. I have not had it in any hardcore rain or anything yet so can't comment on weatherproof/waterproof issues. Because the rain fly covers so much, my last camp out I noticed quite a bit of condensation on the underside of the fly so I could have probably adjusted the fly or unsnapped an end or something to get some more air flowing. Good piece of gear so far. Very affordable, I believed I purchased it for ~$80 from Amazon Prime, it's now $71, get one!
customer_reviews.author: tomatokilla

customer_reviews.title: For a tent that feels like a coffin
customer_reviews.text: Cant beat the price. Look, its 4lbs. For a tent that feels like a coffin, thats not a great minimum weight. However, it was $85, what do you want. Its a shelter, light enough to backpack, keeps the rain out. I use this tent for bike packing. It works great. Do i love it being 4 lbs, no. Was i willing to spend an extra $200 on something thats 2.5 lbs, no i was not. You decide, $200 or 1.5 lb lighter. Probably depends on how much you camp. I decided to keep my $200 and go with this thing. Pretty satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: christopher osborn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: I am typically a hammock camper, but have found the need for a one man tent every now and then. I love this little tent and have found myself using it more often than my hammock. I even attach my ENO rainfly to the tent to create a larger front awning/vestibule to cook, sit and eat under. This tent packs light, goes up easy and is pretty roomy for one person. Furthermore, it breathes amazingly on hot summer Texas nights.
customer_reviews.author: Seth B.

customer_reviews.title: Good tent but too expensive right now.
customer_reviews.text: Alright so this tent is awesome. It’s light, easy to setup, and actually nice inside of it. However, the durability isn’t too good. I’m noticing some of the fabric between the zipper and the tent is starting to come loose by seeing strands of the fabric come out. So I would assume after more uses, there will be ripped parts along the zipper and the tent. This tent is currently priced at 140 due to the demand however it was 70 during early spring. I would wait till off season to buy it at a low price. 140 for this tent is definitely not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Baban Faraj

customer_reviews.title: A great little tent
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a trip hiking out in Washington state. It is a small tent, and I did not have to store my equipment in the tent (it might have been pretty cramped if so). However, it was easy to set up and I slept comfortably inside of it, with room for lighting, books, beverages. The weather was beautiful and rain free the entire time so I cannot attest to its waterproofing. I had purchased a seam sealant, but did not apply it before or during my trip. If you are looking for a one person tent I would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: wareagle7298

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tent. Second back pack trip out with this tent and ended up caught in the rain for a couple hours before I relented and set up. During set up I was able to put up the vestibule and footprint (not included but recommended) before setting up the tent, keeping my tent completely dry. It rained all night and I stayed dry. It's just the size for one with room for small items. Sure it could be bigger, however solo backpacking with easy set up and the ability to set up in the rain is where this tent really shines.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent for Backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Used this tent on a recent 6 day trek through the Sawtooth mountains. Tent was comfortable to carry and super easy to setup. I fit my regular size sleeping pad/bag and had just enough room to stuff my hiking pack behind me comfortably. I didn't encounter any rain so can't speak to how it performs in wet conditions. I did encounter plenty of wind and it held up great. Some condensation buildup on the underside of the rain fly over night in 20F temps, but it didn't seem to pass to the tent. Dried quickly once the sun came up.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Hughey

customer_reviews.title: Great tent at a decent price!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 2-person tent years ago and loved how easy it was to set up. When I went on a backpacking trip with my friends, I needed a one-person tent to lighten my load, this was the logical choice. I was not disappointed, relatively light, compact, and very easy to assemble. We did not experience any rain, but the rain fly actually provided some privacy, particularly for one night we stayed in a larger campground. The funny thing about our trip is that all three of us brought the same tent, with no prior coordination! Bottom line, it's a great purchase, no regrets!
customer_reviews.author: camie

customer_reviews.title: Not super lightweight, but it's fine
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from first use--loved it! Not super lightweight, but it's fine. Well-made, decent ventilation, plenty of room (remember, though--it is a one-person tent!). Very easy set-up and take down, liked the view windows in the rain fly at each end. Haven't used it in the rain, but otherwise it seems to do everything well. Oh, and fantastic customer service--our cat go trapped inside our first tent when we were practicing setting it up when it first arrived, and shredded the tent body. Alps customer service rep (after she stopped laughing) agreed to send me a replacement tent body for a very reasonable cost--recommended! Buy the floor footprint, too.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Kelleher

customer_reviews.title: Hiking, bikepacking, solo, trekking, lightweight Tent
customer_reviews.text: If you’re getting into lightweight/ultra light, bikepacking, or just solo camping - this is probably a good choice for ya. It’s not ultra light for sure BUT it is a gateway into that world. It can be packed down pretty small (smaller than how it arrives) and can be set up in about 4 to 5 minutes. I’m 6’1” and while I would say that my feet will tap the bottom edge, it never bothers a nights rest! The rain fly is legit it should also be used as gear storage under the large vestibule. Good colors for some stealth camping too. (I got grey and burnt orange)
customer_reviews.author: Jacob G.

customer_reviews.title: All you need!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I finally got to use it on a way-backcountry backpacking trip. Light, easy to set up, and very functional. I am 6' 2" tall and 200 lbs and this was plenty for what I wanted to use it for. I could sit up, switch ends if I needed to and sleep quite easily. I was looking for a lightweight tent that provide me with protection from the elements in some degree of comfort. I once got stuck in a 3-day rain with a bivy style tent and I vowed never again. I would recommend it especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: delo609

customer_reviews.title: Heavy for hiking with hills
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a hiking in the French Massif Le Hohneck total of 24 km lots of climbs, and this tent is too heavy. I'm 1.82 m tall, I was pretty comfy inside. I put my hiking bag an Osprey atmo 65 in the vestibule bcz no space inside. Eaysy to mount with lots of cautions in order to not break anything. The footprint is to buy separately and narrow. The stakes are really poor quality (crap) This tent is not build for hard camper and not for long distance with lots of hills Am I gonna used again? Yes Where? Forest hiking with really small elevation. For how long? 10 km max per lap.
customer_reviews.author: makel

customer_reviews.title: An absolute steal!
customer_reviews.text: I just used this tent for a motorcycle trip to the airshow at Oshkosh, WI. I can’t say enough about how well this thing works. Setup could not be simpler, no need to even look at the directions. I wanted freestanding, and shock-corded aluminum poles with no pole sleeves, and this answered all of those requests. Obviously, it is a very small tent, but it still has just barely enough room for me and my gear. This tent is outstanding!
customer_reviews.author: scottincarmel

customer_reviews.title: Well-made/designed & durable
customer_reviews.text: I suppose you could make a tent that's easier to put up/take down, but I don't know how. This little guy got a serious workout this fall; over 20 nights of use in some tough rain/wind, & came through like a champ. I sprayed it with waterproofing & used a cover tarp in really bad rain, but the seams and floor did well. Biggest issue is condensation because of the small interior. Wouldn't use this guy in snow/high wind or on rocky ground without tarp/footprint since the fabric above and below is so light. So far, poles/seams/bag, etc seem well-made and durable....knock on wood... Fabulous value, really. I've spent a lot more for less comfort, portability, and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a recent backpacking weekend and it was so easy to set up and overall I really liked it. I like that it's small, however, it was a little difficult getting out and stepping into my boots to avoid debris inside the tent, even though I am only 5 foot tall I found the low opening a little challenging. But I will use this tent again for the weight, small footprint and ease of setup. I have the footprint as well. Definitely recommend for an affordable lightweight option.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought mine in July 2015. I’ve used it numerous times since then (too many to count) and I absolutely love it. It has withstood multiple day hikes covering miles and the lightweight is such a huge benefit. It’s eash to assemble and very comfortable inside (I do have a very comfortable pad and sleeping bag as well). It’s well ventilated but keeps the cold air out for on the days it got really cold (30’s). For durability, light weight, ease of setup and tearsown, and price, it’s the best tent I have found (I researched for about 6 months before I bought it).
customer_reviews.author: mb4snr

customer_reviews.title: Seam Across  the Floor in the Middle. RETURNED,.
customer_reviews.text: Alps Lynx 1 person Tent Has A Seam Across the Floor! in the middle the short way right where you would sit. WHY WOULD YOU SELL A NEW TENT WITH A SEAM ON THE FLOOR? The Zippers were Tiny and did not work well brand new, Wanted to like this tent! But after waiting a week to get it 10 min after opening it was put back in its Bag and Returned.. BOUGHT a NORTH FACE 1 PERSON TENT
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Easy to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: This is only a one-person tent, but there is plenty of room for me and my pack. The fly adds room for equipment and I have weathered a few rainstorms quite effectively. I don't know how well I would trust this tent in very high winds, or heavy snow, but as a three-season tent it should be just fine. It's certainly not the lightest one-person tent available, but the price and quality are hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Jayebee

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, straight forward assembly, water proof, quick shipping
customer_reviews.text: very happy with this. Was invited to a bike tour with camping and needed something quick. Shipped in one day and gave me a night to test it out before the actual bike tour. Perfect for biking, my panniers and front bag perfectly fit into the nice front area. Best together with the ALPS Mountaineering Lynx 1 Person Tent Floor Saver, which clips nicely to the tent and protects from rainy and wet grounds.
customer_reviews.author: DerAusgewanderte

customer_reviews.title: I am 6' and I fit in it just fine with a few inches of wiggle on each end
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this tent once so far. I am 6' and I fit in it just fine with a few inches of wiggle on each end. • Easy Setup & Take Down • Pegs bent but this is the norm for ones that come with tents. Buy your own good set if you plan on tenting often. Overall if you are looking for a single person tent I would say go for it.
customer_reviews.author: Parkey Phipps

customer_reviews.title: Stands up to strong winds and rain!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic backpacking tent. I have taken it on the AT twice now. My friend had an expensive, super-lightweight tent from REI. One night we set up our tents and then a huge rainstorm blew in. The wind and rain were awful and it lasted a good hour or more. Her tent blew over and got soaked inside, while this one stayed up and dry. I'm no thru-hiker, looking to drop every single ounce I can - we just go out for a few days at a time. So although this tent may weigh a few more ounces than the super-expensive backpacker tents, I'll take the extra ounces if it means staying dry!
customer_reviews.author: Adriel

customer_reviews.title: Great not-for-summer-use tent
customer_reviews.text: a fine tent with terrible ventilation. Sets up easy, seems like solid construction, but holy moly this thing is an oven. A few modifications could go a long way to help. Would love to see a better way to roll up the back half of the fly and still keep tension on the vestibule. The outside temp during my trip was 90° inside the tent was 127° midday. It was unbelievably hot. Save this one for cooler temps. Like 70° and below.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my ten year old grandson. I wanted a tent he could enjoy now for backyard camp outs, but which was also appropriate for him as he gets older. This tent was well recommended by experienced adult campers and it has been easy for him to set up, unassisted now. His Dad says he's never enjoyed a gift more! He's very proud to have a tent that's a real tent, not just a play tent, and has had many hours and days of fun with it already. It's not been tested in serious rain, but I'm confident it will be fine in anything less than a torrential downpour.
customer_reviews.author: happy grandma

customer_reviews.title: Great tent but Small
customer_reviews.text: Great quality tent. Super easy to assemble. But after setting up in my living room I returned because it’s too small for me. I am 6’0”, 220 lbs and length wise it was long enough to lay flat and still have room for gear/pack at feet. However I could not sit up straight in it without my head pressing into the ceiling. This was the deal breaker for me. Other than sleeping flat, not much room for anything else(changing clothes/ tossing and turning or sleeping on your side)
customer_reviews.author: Chloe D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Used during a few upstate New York camping trips (20-35 degrees). A little condensation on the first trip due to me setting up the rain fly incorrectly and not opening the vents. The next few times tent preformed flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: sk00t3r

customer_reviews.title: Very good value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent at this price point. Sewing and seams were all well constructed, zipper and tie down points are sturdy. Set up is simple. Got one for each of my average sized teens and they had plenty of Odom for themselves and a dog each. There are better tents out there at higher price points, but you definitely get a solid tent for your money with this one. No problems recommending.
customer_reviews.author: Spider

customer_reviews.title: Survived a big rain storm.
customer_reviews.text: Have gone backpacking a few times now with this tent. Took it on a few multiday adventures. Pros: Small, water proof, seams are sealed from the factory, easy set up, warm, sturdy, windows are nice. Cons: I tried to think of one. But nothing comes to mind. Maybe could be a bit lighter. On one camping trip it was raining so bad. I couldn't get out of the tent to do anything. So I spent a day in the tent. Water never came in. The wind never blew it around either.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Riedl

customer_reviews.title: Go for it.
customer_reviews.text: Really nice build quality and is a great one man tent. I am pretty fussy and review stuff to death prior to purchase. Trust me you will be happy. Love this tent. Please order the ground sheet for this to preserve your floor. Here is a picture set up in Joshua Tree California.
customer_reviews.author: woodyfx

customer_reviews.title: Simple One-Man Tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple to setup one-man tent. It is well ventilated so you can sleep under the open sky, but still have a protective screen. On rainy nights you can add the top, which includes a vestibule where you can leave your boots, etc. Overall, it's slightly bigger than I would prefer to travel with (probably due to including the vestibule). But it also seems like the best value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: LUCK

customer_reviews.title: Hot in the summer
customer_reviews.text: No rain got inside so that’s great. Not much mesh on the sides so no breezes get in. Mesh on the tent helps somewhat with the heat build-up at least but if you have to have the rainfly on due to rain you melt in the summer. This is better for spring, summer, and possibly winter. I kept putting the rods in wrong. It’s easy to mix up and slide them sown the wrong channel. I finally put a permanent marker dot on one side to eliminate mixing them up.
customer_reviews.author: Rainbow Polkadot 666

customer_reviews.title: I came across this tent and decided it was a good beginner tent for someone just breaking into backpacking/camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my first Backpacking trip over Memorial Day weekend for a 3day/2night stay. After doing over 2 weeks of research, I came across this tent and decided it was a good beginner tent for someone just breaking into backpacking/camping. Setting up this tent is quick and easy and can be done in 2-4 minutes. Our second day, we experienced heavy winds and thunderous rainfall and I was still able to set up and stake down this tent within 5 minutes. Pros: 1. Fast and Easy set up 2. High quality 3. cheap Cons: 1. 4 lbs 2. Just enough room to store backpack and shoes under the fly during rain.
customer_reviews.author: Zain Khan

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the money
customer_reviews.text: Just got off of a 4 day backpacking trip across Catalina Island. All 5 of us were using this tent (3-1 person & 1-2 person). No issues at all. On our 3rd. night, we were camped in a cove (Parsons Landing) and the winds were 25-30 miles an hour. All 4 tents stood the wind with no issues whatsoever. On our 4th. night the coastal moisture came in and the vestibules kept our tents dry as a bone. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Baja Pops

customer_reviews.title: Small but very reliable
customer_reviews.text: This is a stand alone one person tent with small leg room for 1 or 2 small bag next to the legs. If buying this tent, make sure you review the inside size and dont be surprised. The rain cover is very easy to clip on or remove. You can keep the tent and the frame separate if need to adjust space on your bag until get to destination. The seems are very secured and water proofed.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: Set up in under 3-4 minutes, breakdown in under 10. Buy better tent poles and stakes should you purchase this, the ones that came with bent rather easily in mild weather and a replacements - not covered by ALPS - cost nearly the price of the damn tent. Spend the money for a Nemo, this garbage can turn a dry and warm night into a wet and cold one very quickly. 2 stars because it was rather lightweight and held up nicely for 2 weeks in the field. Excellent customer service as well, however I won't be buying from them again.
customer_reviews.author: M.L. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, and very warm
customer_reviews.text: Everything that was advertised was fulfilled, I just had a hard time putting it back in the bag it came in because of how compact it was. I'm going to probably switch it to an old fold camp chair bag because I'm too lazy to fold it properly. I used the tent diagnolly on a 5x7.5 tarp and that was enough to keep the bottom dry. I'm a wide shouldered individual and I sleep on my back and had 2-3 inches of extra space. I'm 5"10 and had enough space to put my backpack in-between the tent wall and my head.
customer_reviews.author: Talon

customer_reviews.title: Great one man tent
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent. Perfect for one person/through trekking. Extremely easy to set up. Left my backback in the vestibule, had room for most of my gear inside. Could hang lantern from middle top. Little bag for important items like phone/flashlight at easy reach. Used in a swamp for 10 days and was totally comfortable. Looking forward to using again soon. Only thing was the ceiling is very low. If claustrophobic, because of the shape, the ceiling is very close to your face when laying down to sleep.... My mom is claustrophobic - this tent would drive her nuts.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Bradley

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, comfortable but NOT Waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy to set up and tear down, lightweight, fairly roomy for a one person Cons: NOT Waterproof. At least mine wasn't. I just came back from a trip to the Sierras and it rained every day, the rainfly was on correctly and I had the groundcover, but the tent let in water at the bottom right seam. Not a tremendous amount, but enough to make me worry during all the other rains.
customer_reviews.author: Feaster

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I recently was able to try this tent out on an overnight trip. This tent worked great for what I needed. I am a tall guy, standing 6'7". I was able to lay down and use my backpack as a pillow and still have room. I was not able to sit up in the tent however. This is a perfect tent for one person to use backpacking. It is quick and easy to use. I had it set up in a matter of minutes. The ventilation is a little lacking, using only two small vent ports in the top of the rain fly. Overall I would buy this tent again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Tent
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a light, cheap tent to take on short backpacking and camping trips. This definitely fit the bill! I am fairly short, but it is just big enough to sleep myself and my large (70 lbs) dog (who curls up pretty small to sleep at my feet) which is awesome! Quality seems pretty great for the price. Haven't tested it in very rough weather yet but it's held up perfectly over several trips this summer. Very quick and easy to assemble and to take down, which I appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: A.L.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful 1-person tent
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely a single person tent. If you are backpacking with your dog he can fit in the vestibule, but not inside the tent if that is what you're looking for. Of course, if you have a tiny dog then I'm sure it'll be fine. I have a 120lb puppy. But this is absolutely perfect for my 400+ mile hike I have coming up. Plus, it was so easy to put up and was done the first time within minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Vantastic

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely cannot beat the price!
customer_reviews.text: Been buying and trying a multitude of tents with most of them extremely high priced and this tent by far is the best and the price cant be beat. Weighs a bit more than most ultralites but by far worth it. Great height and the perfect home in the backcountry! Fir the price you cant not give it a try. I did apply additional waterproofing but not because it was deficient just my extra precautions against weather. I believe this tent will be my go to for a long time. Try it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dana

customer_reviews.title: Great tent but..
customer_reviews.text: Solid and strong. Handles wind rather well when properly staked out. Very warm tent. Not for summer months. Zippers are surprisingly good. Keep in mind it's narrow and tall. Use all stakes and guy lines or it will be somewhere else when you go to the bathroom etc lol.
customer_reviews.author: Don w.

customer_reviews.title: Go to 1 person tent.
customer_reviews.text: Good tent for the price. Did its job on Mt. Hood with snow around, in the forest for hunting season, as well as near the beach. Set up in under 5 minutes. If you're in a wet area it may have some good condensation build up on the inside of the rain fly, but it never gets in the tent or on any of your stuff. This has been my go to tent for all of 2020. Agree with other reviews about the vesituble area. Comes in handy when you want your pack right next to you but not in your space.
customer_reviews.author: Ahop

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, sturdy solo trip tent
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price. Extremely easy to set up. The rain-fly did the job for me in intermittent rains overnight and added enough protected space for my gear and 75 lb. dog. Ventilation seemed good as well. The interior would be a tight fit if you're taller than 6'3"ish or particularly wide and there's barely enough room to sit up, but this is true of any "light" one-person tent.
customer_reviews.author: sewsouthernboutique

customer_reviews.title: Took this bad boy on the application trail and even took some ...
customer_reviews.text: Took this bad boy on the application trail and even took some shroomer boomers and was able to set it up, sleep comfortably and chat it up with some mountain babes after getting buck wild and lost in the trails for like 14 hours. Great tent and highly recommend! I'm also 6ft 3in and can fit perfectly fine in this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Very good little one-man tent!
customer_reviews.text: Got to use it twice this fall - VERY easy to set up, and much sturdier than my previous Eureka! solo tent (which had a fiberglass pole failure). The only con is I am 6'2" and if I sit up during the night, my head will hit the side-wall of the tent since it's sloping upward, and of course it is cold and wet with condensation. But that is to be expected in a tent that is designed to be lightweight, and I am a bit above average height. I knew this would be a possibility, so I did not let it deter me from enjoying a well designed tent. I hope it lasts many years of camping and backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: g00gl3it

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: I used this to solo camp at the bottom of the Grand Canyon, bright angel trail. Held up fine with no rips or tears even being around rock / sand. Very lightweight product and it can get ever lighter if you don't need to pack the rain sheild. Fit just enough room for me to have my sleeping pad with some space on the sides, plenty of space at the head/foot area to store an average amount of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it! Was easy to assemble. And I had never been camping before, so I was worried that it'd be really difficult to put up and that I wouldn't be comfortable. I have a hard time sleeping when it's "too hot" or the air is "too stuffy", I had neither of these problems when sleeping in this tent. I also had no problems with bugs getting in, and the little lamp holder thing at the top was really handy. My only complaint is that putting it back in the bags was difficult, unless you remember how they were originally folded down. Overall, I loved it and definitely look forward to using it in the future!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Sub $100 Solo Tent
customer_reviews.text: I already own the ALPS Mountaineering Aries 3 Tent (which is great for a couple and gear), and wanted something smaller for solo trips. It's about half the weight of the Aries 3, and a little less than half the size, so it fits easily into a backpack or motorcycle top case. Set up takes about a minute too, even with one person. I'm 5'10" and can sit up, but there isn't a ton of headroom. From my experience so far, the build quality is top notch, I'm a big fan of ALPS gear. I don't think you can find a better sub $100 option out there. Buy the matching footprint too.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G

customer_reviews.title: one man tent
customer_reviews.text: To me it was perfect. I was lucky, I didn't find bad weather, so I cannot say it's perfect or water proof, but certainly it is enough coozy to me. It got enough space inside just for yourself and a small bag, but you can put a big backpack outside in the covered area for the night. During the night it was well ventilated and no condens at all. I loved the small windows that gave me the possibility to fell asleep looking at the stars. I think it is more summer like tent, but as I said, I didn't test in harsh conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Giuseppe

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpacking Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is perfect and definitely worth the money. I use it backpacking regularly. It’s small and light weight but it’s a good size when it’s set up. I am almost 6’ and I fit in it with my pack and all my gear. I love the little covered area in front. It gives me a place to put my boots outside the tent such while making sure they are covered from rain. Really love this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is fantastic. First trip was through an overnight downpour. My friend's expensive tent had leaks everywhere, but I was nice and dry! Second trip was an overnight backpacking trip, and the lightweight design made it ideal. It may be difficult for people over 6ft tall, as you won't be able to fit much inside the tent with you. But I had no problems sleeping and having my pack with me inside the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Yoon S

customer_reviews.title: Nice little area outside the tent door for your shoes/socks ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. ONLY use for one person though. Its just enough room for you and your gear. Nice little area outside the tent door for your shoes/socks to dry at night. Perfectly water proof, been through both snow and thunder storms and I'm always bone dry. Never used a bottom liner, and never had any problems with punctures but its not a bad idea to get one. Put this tent through hell and it came out with no holes, and only a tad bit smelly haha. GREAT for the price. I haven't found a better deal to date for a one person tent this lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Crusty Chris

customer_reviews.title: Holds up in rain storm
customer_reviews.text: I've now used this tent multiple times over a year period and can write a tested review. It is a little tight quarters but I knew that initially. I am 5'10, 180 lbs and fit fine but it is tight. My bag and gear must stay under the vestable. As long as you know that going in, you'll love the tent. Most importantly, I endured a 5 hour thunder/rain storm in this tent recently. It had no leaks and held up against strong winds. I was happy with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fast and easy setup.
customer_reviews.text: Great little 1 person tent. It is easy to setup and moderately light. I was impressed with how well this did on a 2 night bikepacking trip in some very remote and COLD conditions. Setup is very quick and easy, takes about 5 minutes once you get the process down. I would highly recommend this for a solo tent.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Could change your life...
customer_reviews.text: This tent is EPIC! What nice quality, and the price is just unbeatable. I was concerned about the strength and quality, then I read a review that said this thing held up through a night of HELL ON EARTH, he was so grateful for this tent, it kept him safe and warm through an insane storm, with very strong winds. Once I got it, and set it up, I can see what he means. This fits me and my dog perfectly, and I can leave my backpack right outside the door, protected under the rain fly. Great job ALPS!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Finally a tent I like.
customer_reviews.text: I have been through lots of 1 person tents, many of which were like the Alps Mountaineering Mystique. I had a few issues with those kinda tents, usually being that they are a pain to set up because they are not freestanding. On top of that, they were always too small (I am 6ft tall). The Lynx tent is the first tent I have used that is absolutely perfect. Great quality and it fits me exactly how I wanted. It fits my LightSpeed self inflating mat correctly and is the right amount of tent for 1 person.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great tent; a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tent. Sets up in about 10 min, rainproof, and has a number of nice little features. Only complaint is that it's heavy. Great all-around. Okay, but not great for backpacking because of the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W.

customer_reviews.title: Nice touches if a little heavier than I'd like
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tent, even if a little heavy for 1 person tent. I liked the vestibules, the vents and the small clear plastic windows at each end positioned so I could view the sky lying either way. Just completed a short three day in the Uinta Wilderness, Utah with no precipitation so I can't say how it does in weather, but it goes up easily and is very roomy for a 1 person tent (I am 6'2"). I got this to replace an old gore tex one man tent from 35 years ago that was very light (#1.5) but very hard to enter/exit and had no room for other than me.
customer_reviews.author: John H. Zouck

customer_reviews.title: Value, Ruggedness, Easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent based off several reviews of people that had used it in different environment and weather conditions. Since getting it, I have spend 11 nights in it through high wind, rain, freezing temperatures, and warm breezes. The tent has held up well in all the described conditions. I am satisfied so far with the quality and ease of use. I am 6'4" 280LBS, I will say it is JUST big enough for someone my size.
customer_reviews.author: RCParrish

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight tent
customer_reviews.text: Great lightweight tent. Easy to set up, easy to take down, and pretty sturdy. I use this when I bring a tent backpacking and it is perfect. Good size vestibule area in front to keep gear dry (covered by rain fly) and enough room for me (6' and 180#) and a pack.
customer_reviews.author: k

customer_reviews.title: Great first lightweight tent.
customer_reviews.text: Being this is my first “lightweight” tent I can’t complain at all about it. Easy to set up (maybe 5 minutes) same time to break down and pack up. The vestibule is awesome to keep my pack and shoes from being in the open, but outside my actual sleeping space. Kept me dry last night in a moderate rain shower. I’m usually a hammock backpacker, but wanted to try this out. Hammock still way more comfortable, but this for sure takes up less space in my pack.
customer_reviews.author: barefootpod

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little tent!
customer_reviews.text: A little heavy for backpacking when you include the faintly but I've been caught in enough surprise( forecasters can't get it right all the time) rain storms that it's worth the extra weight to have the rain protection. Small enough to fit cramped areas and I love that it blends into the scenery better than most. Some people may want bright tent to make it easier to see, but as a single female hiker....I'd rather blend in and go unnoticed lol
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Looks Great at First Sight
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to quickly leave some photographs of how it looks when it arrives. I noticed that even the hang tag has a small metal grommet where the plastic tie goes through. Even that shows a little class. And the slip lock on the case cord is not your standard junk. I'm using this this weekend in the Sierra Nevada mountains with 25° temperatures. I will update my review when I return.
customer_reviews.author: Thai 1 On

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Compact, Light, Efficient Tent
customer_reviews.text: After setting up this tent in a few minutes I just like to sit and laugh at my friends as they continue to set up their cumbersome tent with the sleeves you slide the poles through. Super compact and easy to carry. I don't have a ton of extra room at 6'2" but I never feel cramped, just like i have an efficient amount of space near my feat to store things and plenty of room for my extra wide sleeping pad.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Bell

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Really like this tent. Doesn’t break the bank and it works great. It’s on the heavier side but the brand isn’t known for bein ultra light. Its easy to set up and take down. I’ve used this in nasty storms with no issues in the Everglades and on Florida rivers in the back country. I’m 5’7 240 lbs and I fit just fine in it. It’s a 1p tent so don’t expect anything too spacious but it works.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo Padrino

customer_reviews.title: Great little budget tent
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tent on about 4 trips, and I really don't have any complaints to speak of. This is a great tent on a budget. Light enough, packs down small (look up tutorials, you can get it about 20% smaller than how it comes), super easy setup and takedown, and a price that makes it difficult to justify more expensive tents. Seems well-built, I don't see myself getting a new tent for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Ponall

customer_reviews.title: great quality and size for how light as small the tent is. Thank you!
customer_reviews.text: First off I’m 6’4” and was able to fit in this tent fine.. snug haha but fine. It’s small, light, and compact making it so easy to hike with when you’re camp sight is miles from where you park. It’s super easy to set up and I love how good it holds up in a storm, it rained both nights we were out there ( one of those nights being a pretty intense thunderstorm ) not a single drop in the tent. Very happy customer
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tent! I bought this for my son with ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tent! I bought this for my son with scouts. Mainly because my 2 person (which is similar) was heavier and bulkier. This tent allows me to get it inside his pack and is easy enough to setup (compared to some). Especially since it can free stand (unless it's windy). Great tent! I would have loved to see a thicker floor, definitely get the floor saver (it's also not thick), but if the floor saver tears, at least it wasn't the tent!
customer_reviews.author: Dark Trainer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tent on several AT section hikes and multiday wilderness backpacking trips. Great price and quality. It's not ultra light but for the money can't beat its performance. Unless you are doing a 2000 mile through hike, this tent should answer your needs at a fraction of other tents.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Tried and true...
customer_reviews.text: Just came back from a 4 day hike/snow shoe in the cascades, ele 6200ft, snow depth 2 1/2ft, winds light.Temp low 26 deg. Love every thing about this tent; easy set up/break down weight and durability to price being able to sit up comfortably enough room stow things inside, but not extra wasted floor space the addition of the extended triangle rain fly so i didn't have to bring my boots and pack in the tent, but kept them dry and secure was awesome I cannot attest to how this tent holds up in high winds or the rain, but there's plenty other reviews you can read on that
customer_reviews.author: deadhorse

customer_reviews.title: Not built to withstand what i read in the description,
customer_reviews.text: I am Older been camping in the White mountains for many years, This tent MAY make a few trips, I used it in my yard as I do ALL my new tents, And will NEVER carry it out side my yard,, I have lot of ALPS gear, And this one piece disappointed me BAD
customer_reviews.author: keith

customer_reviews.title: Great for adventurous trips!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was light for my full backpacking trip and was easy to set up in less than 5 minutes with enough space to keep my personal belonging inside from the weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spend more and get a better tent.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is pretty bulky for its size, and heavy too. I wouldn't recomend it for backpacking nor for camping. Doesn't really serve any purpose as its too heavy to carry distance and too small for car camping. Spend the extra bucks and buy something from REI or a small manufacturer like zpacks or gossamer gear.
customer_reviews.author: Zack M.

customer_reviews.title: I like it :)
customer_reviews.text: I am really excited about the simplicty of the pole system. 2 sticks under tension x-sing over the top! Late night camp pitchin with frozen fingers....Thank you very much for taking out fine motor skills. Just makes it for a more comforrable experience after a long haul. The air vents on top, with a riser support are amazingly thought out. The configuration doesnt allow rain to get in. The rain fly extends enough to stow gear away from weather. Makes also for nice kitchen during rainy days. There is great headroom and the sacrifice is catching some wind. I add extra rope support if I can't get out of shifting winds.
customer_reviews.author: Tamer Gurmen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent with strong zippers
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent with strong zippers! I used it in warm weather without the included rainfly. Easy to setup without using instructions. As others have said, instructions are stitched into carry bag in case you need them. People with tents triple the price admired this one at the campground I stayed at. It's big enough for one person, packs up into a small bag and sets up in no time. I'll be buying more as a gift for family.
customer_reviews.author: TW

customer_reviews.title: Great tent excepting storage bag
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy set up, roomy for a 1 man and nice vestibule. I took it on a 5 day adarondak hike. The only problem I had is with the stow pack the tent fits into. It tore on both ends and that is without keeping the poles in it. If you're on a longer trek look into getting a more substantial storage bag for it. Hope maker reads this because this fix makes this a 5 star+ tent.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Moletteri

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have several tents and ordered this one for a trip to Aus this summer (their winter) and wasn’t expecting much based on the price but the quality is on par with the Kelty tents I have. I can’t speak to the longevity but it worked awesome for the handful of nights I camped. I wouldn’t winter camp in the Rockies with this thing but it’s up to the task for anything else.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory R Huston

customer_reviews.title: Holding up great after 2 years of continuous backpacking
customer_reviews.text: I have used this in wet, cold, windy and hot tempuratures backpacking in the North Carolina and Georgia Appalachians. Cold temps below 10F and some swampy hot nights in the summer. Its a great tent for the price. Get a footprint that helps. If you change up the right layers, pads and sleeping bag you should be ok making this a four season shelter. I wear my 800 down jacket, balaclava in my 0 degree mummy bag for the sub 20 nights and sleep comfortably. Ill probably use it for years to come
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bike Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Use it for my summer motorcycle rides. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Great solo backpacking tent
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used mine many times at this point in downpours, snowstorms and everything in between and it’s kept up great and hasn’t had any problems, everything is functional. I had to respray waterproofing spray as is recommended for all tents and it’s still functioning like new after a year, great product for the price point
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Donohue

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice! Lynx!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good quality lightweight tent for the price.Perfect for the Bike Packer like myself or any outdoor enthusiast. Easy to make up and pack down. I really like this tent and it's feature's and would recommend to anyone looking for a good solo tent.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamen G.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap tent, fell apart after first use
customer_reviews.text: The tent completely fell apart after just one use. It’s made very cheaply and the material does not stand up to the elements well. I had a strap on the rain fly break the first night I camped in this tent. When I tried to contact the seller, they chose not to respond at all or even acknowledge my concern. With a tent, you get what you pay for. Take your money elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Super fast to setup, and at 6'0" @ 180lbs I have more than enough room. Purchased an air mattress and the ALPS Lynx floor protector. Also despite how the pictures look, the tent is 100% Sealed from the outdoor elements. So rain, wind, etc. won't phase you. Very happy with this tent for the money, and use it on some outdoor adventures spring through fall.
customer_reviews.author: AJames

customer_reviews.title: A mildly inebriated fool assembled this tent in the dark in 2 minutes with no directions,1st try!
customer_reviews.text: 4.15.19: assembled tent for the first time in the dark with no instructions but sufficient alcohol in two minutes. Intentionally picked a windy, rainy night with wet ground, skipping guy wires. If I don't report back tomorrow, I am probably dead so I beat in mind that my rating is more "5 stars of expectation" than "5 stars of performance." UPDATE: tent performed as hoped, no leaks from wet ground below (no rain from above, though), didn't be away despite gusts.
customer_reviews.author: David Lively

customer_reviews.title: great tent
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent , its light , super easy to set up , literally takes 5 minutes , and although it is only a 3 season tent , with the proper sleep system it kept me out of the wind and comfortable at zero degrees F. I would however say if you are a big person you may find it a tight fit , i'm 5' 10" 160 lbs theres not a whole bunch of room for much else , had to leave my pack in the outcove , all in all i'm pleased with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good tent and price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to take to the boundary waters on 5 day canoe camping trip. Easy to set up and quick. plenty of room. I am only 4'11 so I had TONS of leg room and space along the side of sleeping bag for gear and to move about. ONly complaint is that the back window is covered by rainfly and you cannot see out of it. Kept mosquitos out. Our GS council also uses this brand for council trips. We have been use 4 mans for over three years now with out problem.s
customer_reviews.author: Stacy W. Reaves

customer_reviews.title: Fast setup and great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this tent. Fit great on the exterior of the pack, actually fits back into it's bag. Easy and very fast to set up. Unfortunately my friends tent flooded and the night was expected to be very cold. Yes you can fit 2 people. But it's extremely tight and something I hope I won't ever do again.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Lynx 1-Person Tent
feature_bullets: There's no assembly frustration with our Lynx tent Series; This free-standing, aluminum two-pole design is a breeze to setup
Polyester tent fly resists water and UV damage while adding one vestibule for extra storage space
Fully equipped with #8 zippers, storage pockets, gear loft, stakes, guy ropes and one doorway
The Alps Mountaineering Lynx tent is on our best sellers list; it’s a must-have for your next adventure.Weatherproof fly buckles on for maximum adjustability and protection
Base size: 2'8 x 7'6, center height: 36", total weight: 4 lbs. 1 oz. , minimum Weight: 3 lbs. 5 oz. , Color: Clay/Rust

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
